title: Dinner Tonight: Stir-Fried Shrimp with Tomato Sauce
summary: Dinner Tonight: Stir-Fried Shrimp with Tomato Sauce is a gluten free and pescatarian recipe with 2 servings. For $1.39 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains about 10g of protein, 44g of fat, and a total of 580 calories. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have shrimp, condensed milk, salt, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 27%, this dish is rather bad. Similar recipes are Dinner Tonight: Stir Fried Rice Cake with Gochujang Sauce, Dinner Tonight: Chicken Stir-Fried with Lemongrass and Chile, and Dinner Tonight: Dongting Stir-fried Duck Breast.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 99 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Beat the half egg white with the starch, oil, and salt. Toss in the shrimp and stir to coat.                                                                                                                              2                                                                            In a saucepan, combine the vinegar, sugar, and tomato paste.  Turn the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil, stirring constantly until dissolved.  Then turn the heat to medium-low, and cook until reduced slightly. Sprinkle in a pinch of cayenne, adding more if you like lots of heat.                                                                                                                              3                                                                            In a large skillet, pour enough oil to cover the bottom by one-fourth an inch. Crank the heat to high, and wait until almost smoking. Add the shrimp and cook until pink on both sides and the batter turns golden brown. Times will depend on the size of the shrimp and how hot the oil is.  You might need to do this in batches. When done, transfer the shrimp to the tomato sauce.  Toss to coat.  Serve up with more cayenne if you so dare.                                                                                                                              4                                                                            Now for the creamy, cold sauce in question:                                                                                                                            5                                                                            Mayonnaise Sauce                                                                                                                            6                                                                            Combine mayonnaise, condensed milk, and lemon juice in a large bowl.  Whisk until combined. Season with salt and cayenne to taste.

steps.step: Beat the half egg white with the starch, oil, and salt. Toss in the shrimp and stir to coat.

In a saucepan, combine the vinegar, sugar, and tomato paste.  Turn the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil, stirring constantly until dissolved.  Then turn the heat to medium-low, and cook until reduced slightly.
Sprinkle in a pinch of cayenne, adding more if you like lots of heat.
In a large skillet, pour enough oil to cover the bottom by one-fourth an inch. Crank the heat to high, and wait until almost smoking.

Add the shrimp and cook until pink on both sides and the batter turns golden brown. Times will depend on the size of the shrimp and how hot the oil is.  You might need to do this in batches. When done, transfer the shrimp to the tomato sauce.  Toss to coat.
Serve up with more cayenne if you so dare.

analyzedInstructions.name: Now for the creamy, cold sauce in question

steps.step: Combine mayonnaise, condensed milk, and lemon juice in a large bowl.
Whisk until combined. Season with salt and cayenne to taste.
